answers.answer: Did they call it diabetic gastroparesis?  I suspect that's what his diagnosis is, and it's not something you should forget because without it, people are starting over if you want help.  Diabetes can damage a digestive nerve and cause gastroparesis.  I don't think there is anything that can help the nerve once it's damaged, but controlling blood sugar is important.  You could see if probiotics or digestive enzymes help, but it may not.  I would suggest taking the question to the diabetes forum.
thank you so much. Yes, that was the diagnosis after several misdiagnosis. I will refer to the diabetic division. Happy new Year.Lauren
